intro: Conyza araneosa, commonly known as the "spider plant," is a flowering plant native to Africa, South America, and parts of Asia. It is an annual herb that typically grows to a height of 30–60 centimeters, featuring slender stems and small, greenish-white flowers. The plant is characterized by its finely divided leaves and the production of numerous small, wind-dispersed seeds. It thrives in disturbed soils and is often found in fields, roadsides, and waste areas. Conyza araneosa is also known for its ability to spread rapidly, making it a common weed in many regions.
